title: Giorgos Koltsidas
text:
Giorgos Koltsidas (, born 23 September 1970) is a retired <a href="association%20football">football</a> player, who played as a <a href="Defender%20%28football%29">defender</a> and was known for his strong <a href="sliding%20tackle">tackles</a>. He is currently the general director of <a href="Aris%20Thessaloniki%20F.C.">Aris</a>.
He started his career with <a href="Trikala%20F.C.">Trikala</a> and joined Aris in July 1992, where he spent the majority of his career – except for a brief one-year spell at <a href="Larissa%20F.C.">Larissa</a>. He retired at the end of the <a href="2007%E2%80%9308%20Superleague%20Greece">2007–08 season</a>.
He was a member of the <a href="Greece%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Greece national under-21 football team</a> which won the gold medal at the <a href="1991%20Mediterranean%20Games">1991 Mediterranean Games</a>.
